Just imagine your future with us… At Aurecon we see the future through a very different lens. Do you? JOB DESCRIPTION (TUNNEL LEADER – LEVEL 7 / E6E) The primary scope of works, roles, duties, and/or responsibilities in the position of Tunnel leader is working in close alignment with Aurecon Thailand Teams to ensure Aurecon’s projects are delivered in accordance with Aurecon strategy. Develop and implement business development (including prepare proposal) for local and regional tunnel projects Lead project management and design management of ground engineering and tunnel projects. Design and analysis of tunnel excavation stabilization works Design and analysis of tunnel lining including reinforced concrete / shotcrete lining, steel supports, and timbers Design and analysis of slope reinforcements including soil nails, rock dowels, and tensioned tie back anchors Design and analysis of portal structures and other structural elements of tunnels Preparation of plans and technical specifications Mentor and Coach staff Present tunnelling topics in a compelling way to Clients and internal and external stakeholders Liaise with Aurecon staff in Australia and New Zealand for workshare and workshare opportunities. You will also need a relevant technical qualification and chartered status would be preferable. Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Civil Engineer, Structural Engineer Possess a Professional Engineer License certified by the Council of Engineers, Thailand or 2nd level of Engineer License is preferred. At least 15 years design experience in ground and underground engineering with a consulting engineering company will be an advantage Proficient in English communication skills and computer literate Our Aurecon Attributes describe the types of people we bring together for clients. Drawing on our deep pool of expertise, we co-create innovative solutions with our clients to some of the world’s most complex challenges. And through a range of unique creative processes and skills, we work to re-imagine, shape and design a better future. We listen deeply and intently, which helps us see opportunities, possibilities and potential that others can’t. Think engineering. Think again. Want to know more? Apply now!
